intro: Darniella sinaica, commonly known as the Sinai Darniella, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Sinai Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant has finely divided, feather-like leaves that help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. It produces small white or pale yellow flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and flies. Darniella sinaica is adapted to thrive in sandy soils and can survive in extreme temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
